newsitem.title: USA: AMEX adds options trading for five companies.
newsitem.headline: AMEX adds options trading for five companies.

text.p: The American Stock Exchange said it will start trading options this week on ABN AMRO Holding NV and four other companies.
ABN Amro is based in Amsterdam, the Netherlands. Options trading on its American Depositary Shares will begin June 6, the exchange said in a news release.
Trading will open with strike prices of 17-1/2, 20 and 22-1/2, with position limits of 4,500 contracts.
The American Stock Exchange also said it will trade options on the over-the-counter stocks of CHS Electronics Inc, Documentum Inc, West Marine Inc and World Access Inc.
CHS Electronics will open with strike prices of 22-1/2, 25 and 30, and position limits of 7,500 contracts.
Documentum will open with strike prices of 17-1/2, 20 and 22-1/2, with position limits of 4,500 contracts.
West Marine will openwith strike prices of 22-1/2, 25 and 30, with position limits of 4,500 contracts.
World Access will open with strike prices of 15, 17-1/2 and 20, with position limits of 7,500 contracts.
For all the companies, initial expiration months will be June, July and October 1997 and January 1998.
